channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Hospitals Can’t Keep Hiding Their Prices from Patients
item.description: Many Americans have no way of knowing how much a hospital will charge them for a routine procedure until weeks later when the bill arrives in the mail...

item.title: Civil rights group declares 'state of emergency,' pointing at Trump admin
item.description: The National Urban League issued a report that takes aim at President Donald Trump's administration, suggesting the nation faces a "state of emergency...

item.title: Timeline of 'scam artist' Adam Schiff's mortgage fraud allegations stretching back years
item.description: Longtime Trump political foe, Sen. Adam Schiff, was referred to the Department of Justice to face criminal prosecution over alleged mortgage fraud tha...

item.title: Report: America’s Debt Situation Will Soon Be Worse Than Right After World War II
item.description: Our country cannot get its fiscal house in order unless and until it starts slowing the explosion of Medicare spending.

item.title: As AI comes for entry-level gigs, Whole Foods exec says the $13.7 billion grocer is reviving artisans with butcher, cheese, and bakery apprenticeships
item.description: About 1,300 Whole Foods employees have been upskilled in an artisan craft from fishmongering to cake decorating, offering unemployed Gen Z an alternat...

item.title: 'Dear God': Democrats storm out of vote on controversial Trump nominee
item.description: Democrats left the room before the panel voted to confirm the judicial nomination of Trump's former personal attorney, Emil Bove.

item.title: Republican senators caution Trump against firing Fed chair Jerome Powell
item.description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell is gaining some key backing on Capitol Hill from GOP senators who fear the repercussions if President Donald Trump...

item.title: Army secretary vows 'grievous error' targeting pro-life groups will never happen again
item.description: Army Secretary Dan Driscoll called it "deeply inappropriate" that military training slides wrongly categorizing pro-life organizations as extremist gr...

item.title: Slack’s paid users are getting new time-saving AI tools
item.description: Tools are meant to improve productivity.

item.title: The Biden Autopen Scandal
item.description: It keeps getting worse.

item.title: Senate panel advances Trump's former defense attorney Emil Bove toward federal appeals court position
item.description: Trump's former defense attorney Emil Bove faces opposition from former judges and Democrats as his nomination for the Third Circuit Court of Appeals f...

item.title: Auditors Downplay Tens Of Thousands Registered To Vote Without Proof Of Citizenship In Oregon
item.description: Auditors found one in 35 voters didn’t have proof of citizenship — then looked the other way.

item.title: The End Is Still Near
item.description: Birth rates are falling, but Paul Ehrlich, who famously coined the term ‘the population bomb,’ is unmoved by the data.

item.title: Jamie Dimon turned down Jeff Bezos and a top gig at Amazon to take on ‘troubled’ Bank One in a $60 million bet
item.description: Dimon told the "Acquired" podcast that the version of his life where he moved to Seattle to work at Amazon is an "alternate universe."

item.title: The Alcaraz-Sinner Rivalry Is Kicking Off A New Generation Of Tennis Greats
item.description: The next golden age of men’s tennis is unfolding before our very eyes, and that should make everyone happy — including the pickleball players.

item.title: In their own words: Trump, Patel, Bongino and Bondi on the Epstein scandal
item.description: When Jeffrey Epstein died in prison, then-President Donald Trump speculated that authorities might be wrong in ruling it a suicide.

item.title: Why the Fed Should Cut Rates Now
item.description: The economy is poised to grow. The job now falls to the Fed and Treasury to cut, sell, and coordinate before the window of opportunity closes.

item.title: Senate passes $9 billion in spending cuts to public broadcasting, foreign aid requested by Trump
item.description: The Senate has passed about $9 billion in federal spending cuts requested by President Donald Trump, including deep reductions to public broadcasting ...

item.title: Why Prudes Are The Only Ones Consistently Having Good Sex
item.description: Human flourishing consists less of discovering who we are than of becoming who we ought to be.

item.title: Virtuos helped make one of the year’s best-selling video games. Now, 300 of its workers may be out of a job
item.description: The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered became the third-best-selling video game of 2025 in less than a week.

item.title: Adults Obsessively Buying Collectable Dolls Is A Symptom Of A Sick Culture
item.description: American adults' obsession with immaturity is far more dangerous than nostalgia.

item.title: Berthe Weill: Tigress Dealer for the Young Picasso, Matisse, and Chagall
item.description: Montreal’s fine-arts museum rediscovers Paris’s premiere talent spotter.

item.title: Trump hosts Persian Gulf leaders at White House as new violence raises questions about peace efforts
item.description: President Donald Trump hosted a pair of Arab Gulf leaders at the White House on Wednesday as violence between Israel and Syria renewed doubts about hi...

item.title: Trump’s Coca Cola post tanked share prices for high fructose corn syrup makers
item.description: Shares for Archer-Daniels-Midland and Ingredion both fell at least 6% in after hours trading.

item.title: Top 10 Most Read Blogs from Q2: AI, Alpha, and a Shifting Global Order
item.description: AI disruption, portfolio shifts, and timeless lessons—these blogs topped the charts in Q2.

item.title: Schiff mortgage fraud probe could end in stiff fines, penalties for senator
item.description: The type of mortgage fraud case in which Sen. Adam Schiff is now entangled is usually clear-cut and hard to wiggle out of, said financial crimes exper...

item.title: Book Review: The Behavioral Portfolio
item.description: Phillip Toews challenges traditional portfolio construction, helping advisors build resilient strategies and coach clients through risk and bias.

item.title: Rethinking Research: Private GPTs for Investment Analysis
item.description: This chatbot-style tool allows investment analysts to query complex research materials in plain language without ever exposing sensitive data.

item.title: Mind the Inflation Gap: Hedging with Real Assets
item.description: Timely insights on portfolio risk, inflation hedging, and market cycles—grounded in financial history and written for investment decision-makers.

item.title: Book Review: Cheaper Faster Better: How We’ll Win the Climate War
item.description: Can capitalism save the planet? Tom Steyer makes the case in this urgent, optimistic roadmap to a net-zero future.
